verses.verse: And if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, and <S%H8085>hear<s%> the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of <S%H423>swearing<s%>, and is a <S%H5707>witness<s%>, <S%H176>whether<s%> he hath <S%H7200>seen<s%> or <S%H3045>known<s%> of it; if he do not <S%H5046>utter<s%> it, then he shall <S%H5375>bear<s%> his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

Or if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H5060>touch<s%> any <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H1697>thing<s%>, whether it be a <S%H5038>carcase<s%> of an <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H2416>beast<s%>, or a <S%H5038>carcase<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> <S%H929>cattle<s%>, or the <S%H5038>carcase<s%> of <S%H2931>unclean<s%> creeping <S%H8318>things<s%>, and if it be <S%H5956>hidden<s%> from him; he also shall be <S%H2931>unclean<s%>, and <S%H816>guilty<s%>.

Or if he <S%H5060>touch<s%> the <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> of <S%H120>man<s%>, whatsoever <S%H2932>uncleanness<s%> it be that a man shall be <S%H2930>defiled<s%> withal, and it be <S%H5956>hid<s%> from him; when he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> of it, then he shall be <S%H816>guilty<s%>.

Or if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H7650>swear<s%>, <S%H981>pronouncing<s%> with his <S%H8193>lips<s%> to do <S%H7489>evil<s%>, or to do <S%H3190>good<s%>, whatsoever it be that a <S%H120>man<s%> shall <S%H981>pronounce<s%> with an <S%H7621>oath<s%>, and it be <S%H5956>hid<s%> from him; when he <S%H3045>knoweth<s%> of it, then he shall be <S%H816>guilty<s%> in <S%H259>one<s%> of these.
And it shall be, when he shall be <S%H816>guilty<s%> in <S%H259>one<s%> of these things, that he shall <S%H3034>confess<s%> that he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%> in that thing:

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> his trespass <S%H817>offering<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> for his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, a <S%H5347>female<s%> from the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, a <S%H3776>lamb<s%> or a <S%H8166>kid<s%> of the <S%H5795>goats<s%>, for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>; and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him concerning his <S%H2403>sin<s%>.

And if <S%H3027>he<s%> be not <S%H1767>able<s%> to <S%H5060>bring<s%> a <S%H7716>lamb<s%>, then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> <S%H854>for<s%> his <S%H817>trespass<s%>, which he hath <S%H2398>committed<s%>, <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtledoves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; <S%H259>one<s%> for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>, and the <S%H259>other<s%> for a burnt <S%H5930>offering<s%>. he be: Heb. his hand cannot reach to the sufficiency of a lamb

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> them unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, who shall <S%H7126>offer<s%> that which is for the sin <S%H2403>offering<s%> <S%H7223>first<s%>, and wring <S%H4454>off<s%> his <S%H7218>head<s%> <S%H4136>from<s%> his <S%H6203>neck<s%>, but shall not divide it <S%H914>asunder<s%>:

And he shall <S%H5137>sprinkle<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> of the sin <S%H2403>offering<s%> upon the <S%H7023>side<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>; and the <S%H7604>rest<s%> of the <S%H1818>blood<s%> shall be wrung <S%H4680>out<s%> at the <S%H3247>bottom<s%> of the <S%H4196>altar<s%>: it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

And he shall <S%H6213>offer<s%> the <S%H8145>second<s%> for a burnt <S%H5930>offering<s%>, according to the <S%H4941>manner<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him for his <S%H2403>sin<s%> which he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%>, and it shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%> him. manner: or, ordinance

But if <S%H3027>he<s%> be not able to <S%H5381>bring<s%> <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H8449>turtledoves<s%>, or <S%H8147>two<s%> <S%H1121>young<s%> <S%H3123>pigeons<s%>, then he that <S%H2398>sinned<s%> shall <S%H935>bring<s%> for his <S%H7133>offering<s%> the <S%H6224>tenth<s%> part of an <S%H374>ephah<s%> of fine <S%H5560>flour<s%> for a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>; he shall <S%H7760>put<s%> no <S%H8081>oil<s%> upon it, neither shall he <S%H5414>put<s%> any <S%H3828>frankincense<s%> thereon: for it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

Then shall he <S%H935>bring<s%> it to the <S%H3548>priest<s%>, and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall <S%H7061>take<s%> his <S%H4393>handful<s%> <S%H7062><s%> of it, even a <S%H234>memorial<s%> thereof, and <S%H6999>burn<s%> it on the <S%H4196>altar<s%>, according to the offerings made by <S%H801>fire<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>: it is a sin <S%H2403>offering<s%>.

And the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him as touching his <S%H2403>sin<s%> that he hath <S%H2398>sinned<s%> in <S%H259>one<s%> of these, and it shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%> him: and the remnant shall be the <S%H3548>priest's<s%>, as a meat <S%H4503>offering<s%>.

If a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H4603>commit<s%> a <S%H4604>trespass<s%>, and <S%H2398>sin<s%> through <S%H7684>ignorance<s%>, in the holy <S%H6944>things<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; then he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> for his <S%H817>trespass<s%> unto the <S%H3068>LORD<s%> a <S%H352>ram<s%> without <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flocks<s%>, with thy <S%H6187>estimation<s%> by <S%H8255>shekels<s%> of <S%H3701>silver<s%>, after the <S%H8255>shekel<s%> of the <S%H6944>sanctuary<s%>, for a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>:

And he shall make <S%H7999>amends<s%> for the <S%H2398>harm<s%> that he hath done in the holy <S%H6944>thing<s%>, and shall <S%H3254>add<s%> the fifth <S%H2549>part<s%> thereto, and <S%H5414>give<s%> it unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him with the <S%H352>ram<s%> of the trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>, and it shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%> him.

And if a <S%H5315>soul<s%> <S%H2398>sin<s%>, and <S%H6213>commit<s%> <S%H259>any<s%> of these things which are forbidden to be <S%H6213>done<s%> by the <S%H4687>commandments<s%> of the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>; though he <S%H3045>wist<s%> it not, yet is he <S%H816>guilty<s%>, and shall <S%H5375>bear<s%> his <S%H5771>iniquity<s%>.

And he shall <S%H935>bring<s%> a <S%H352>ram<s%> without <S%H8549>blemish<s%> out of the <S%H6629>flock<s%>, with thy <S%H6187>estimation<s%>, for a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>, unto the <S%H3548>priest<s%>: and the <S%H3548>priest<s%> shall make an <S%H3722>atonement<s%> for him concerning his <S%H7684>ignorance<s%> wherein he <S%H7683>erred<s%> and <S%H3045>wist<s%> it not, and it shall be <S%H5545>forgiven<s%> him.
It is a trespass <S%H817>offering<s%>: he hath <S%H816>certainly<s%> <S%H816>trespassed<s%> against the <S%H3068>LORD<s%>.
